data.title: Computers and the Coming of the U.S. Keiretsu
data.meta_description: No matter that the United States still leads in developing the most innovative technologies. If U.S. and European companies continue business as usual, they will either fail outright or become, in effect, local design and marketing subsidiaries of Japanese companies that will dominate a $1 trillion world hardware industry. The endangered list includes most of […]
data.text:
CF

Charles H. Ferguson, an MIT Ph.D. and former MIT researcher, is an independent consultant, also in Cambridge. This article is based on their book Computer Wars: How the West Can Win in a Post-IBM World, which was just published by Times Books
